subject: History
title: The HIV/AIDS Crisis
description: A fast breakdown of The HIV/AIDS Crisis for builders.

hook.text: In 1981, doctors noticed young men dying of rare cancers. A new virus was silently spreading across the globe.

buildup.text: HIV attacked the immune system itself. By 1990, 8 million people were infected worldwide.

discovery.text: Antiretroviral therapy, introduced in 1996, transformed HIV from a death sentence to a manageable condition.

twist.text: Governments initially ignored the crisis because it struck gay men, drug users, and Africans firstâ€”the marginalized.

climax.text: Over 40 million people have died of AIDS. The pandemic exposed how prejudice shapes public health responses.

punchline.text: A virus revealed who society was willing to save.

quiz.question: What breakthrough in 1996 changed HIV from a death sentence to a manageable condition?
options: A vaccine that prevented HIV infection
Antiretroviral therapy that suppressed the virus
Gene therapy that removed HIV from the body
